title: Design and Operational Strategies for Communities of Practice (CoP): Problem-Centered Learning for Language Education Settings

context.prior_knowledge: Expert-level knowledge and experience in solving complex problems
context.additional_context: Focuses on solving practical challenges faced by language educators when designing and operating communities of practice in a smartphone-dominated learning environment.

learning_goals: Learners can explain three or more core principles and design frameworks of Communities of Practice (CoP)
Learners can diagnose five potential issues (e.g., lack of participation motivation, knowledge-sharing barriers) and propose improvement strategies when designing an online language education CoP
Learners can plan LMS-based CoP activities (discussions, resource sharing, feedback) and develop operational strategies optimized for mobile environments
Learners can measure CoP participation effectiveness through formative assessments and derive improvement directions

resources: Community of Practice (CoP) Case Study Materials
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
